alert.note: Alert for Alexander; Jackson; Pulaski; Union; Williamson (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 05 at 12:17PM CDT until April 05 at 12:45PM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: The National Weather Service in Paducah has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Union County in southern Illinois... Pulaski County in southern Illinois... Southwestern Williamson County in southern Illinois... Southeastern Jackson County in southern Illinois... Alexander County in southern Illinois... Central Scott County in southeastern Missouri... East central Cape Girardeau County in southeastern Missouri... East central Stoddard County in southeastern Missouri... * Until 1245 PM CDT. * At 1216 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Cedar Lake Area to near Kelso to near Bell City, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Cape Girardeau, Scott City, Anna, Jonesboro, Oran, Benton, Cobden, Dongola, Morley, Tamms, Bell City, Hay-Wood City, Horseshoe Lake Conservation Area, Olive Branch, Ware, Cedar Lake Area, Makanda, Ullin, Thebes and Alto Pass. This includes the following highways... Interstate 57 in Illinois between Mile Markers 10 and 39. Interstate 55 between Mile Markers 72 and 86. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 PM CDT for southern Illinois...and southeastern Missouri. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 PM CDT for southern Illinois...and southeastern Missouri.
